title: Petrol gets cheaper but the price of crisps is going up
text:
Petrol prices fell in September despite turmoil in the global oil markets, helping to keep a lid on living expenses and support the economy - although the cost of crisps ticked up.

The average litre of petrol cost 127.3p last month, down a penny from August despite a sudden spike in prices after an attack on Saudi oil facilities, much to the relief of the nation’s drivers.

Food inflation held steady at 1.6pc, but that disguised some bigger moves in certain products, including a more than 5pc rise in crisp prices. The Office for National Statistics did not give a reason for the increasing costs of crisps but it had reported rising potato prices earlier in the year. Pizza, yoghurt and ice cream...
description: Petrol prices fell in September despite turmoil in the global oil markets, helping to keep a lid on living expenses and support the economy - although the cost of crisps ticked up.
